title: (x) G-Star futuristic sans - custom drawn logo {Bert}
content:
Hello! could anyone possible ID this font for me? I'm assuming it is a font!

[http://www.assemblydesign.co.uk/gstar.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022064321/http:/www.assemblydesign.co.uk/gstar.gif)
author: furryvision

comments.content:
Handmade — looks a lot like the logotype I drew for a Sony-contest in 1981.

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO
Some other suggestions for a squarish technoid G-Sans [overhere](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022064321/http:/www.typophile.com/node/10984) …

Depending on your point of view about this, there are an _awful_ lot of very similar fonts to be found in the 'Techno' category at Dafont.com. I am no longer surprised at how often I find the answers to Techno font ID questions by setting the sample to the mystery font letters and then scrolling the selections looking for a match.

In the commercial world Identikal, Psy/Ops, and T-26 are some of the places I look first for 'Techno'. Ray Larabie's work bridges both worlds, as he has made many free fonts of this style, with polished up commercial versions.

- Mike Yanega
